artist.name: Wechie Prosper
artist.bio: I work with silence, proportion, and the ethics of attention. My images are built like pages: edited, weighted, and designed to be read slowly. I’m interested in the moment an artwork stops performing and becomes present — when the viewer leans in, not because it shouts, but because it refuses noise.

home.hero_headline:
I do not decorate.
I document feeling.
I build images that hold still.
home.hero_sub: Selected works, commissions, and licensing — presented as an exhibition catalogue.
home.about_text: My practice is editorial: each piece is composed with the discipline of print. I treat whitespace as material and hierarchy as a form of respect. Whether a cover illustration or a conceptual plate, the goal is the same: to create a quiet object of attention — museum-grade, unhurried, exact.
